temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.flow
Class MaxFlow

java.lang.Object
  temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.flow.MaxFlow
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, Algorithm, Filtering
public class MaxFlow
extends java.lang.Object
implements Algorithm, Filtering

Push-Relabel max flow and min cut algorithm with heuristics.

For description of network flows, see the package summary.

Implementation Notes

This algorithm implements the push-relabel method for computing the maximum flow of a directed graph. It uses highest-level-first node selection and gap relabelling as well as global relabelling heuristics. It uses a two phase variant of the method. This work is derived primarily from
  • Reading the source code from Andrew Goldberg's h_prf.
  • Reading the LEDA manual.
It follows neither approach to a tee, but is basically a mixture of the two.

Constructor Detail

MaxFlow

public MaxFlow(Digraph dg,
               Node source,
               Node sink,
               IntEdgeMap caps,
               EdgeMap<Edge> flip)
Construct a new MaxFlow push-relabel algorithm. The input should be adequately prepared for a maximum flow. In particular,
  • The digraph should be symmetric, so that for every edge u,v there is an edge v,u.
  • The capacities should be non-negative
  • The sink vertex should contain no outgoing edges with non zero capacity.
  • The source vertex should contain no incoming edges with non zero capacity.
For preparing a graph for this method, please refer to the MakeSymmetric symmetrizer.

Parameters:
dg - A digraph as described above.
source - The source vertex.
sink - The sink vertex.
caps - The capacities of the edges. If an edge was added just for symmetrization, its capacity should be 0.
flip - An attribute array containing the reverse of each edge for each edge.
Method Detail

minCut

public static java.util.BitSet minCut(Digraph digraph,
                                      Node source,
                                      Node sink,
                                      IntEdgeMap capacities,
                                      EdgeMap<Edge> flip)
Compute a min cut for a properly prepared st-digraph.

Parameters:
digraph - the input digraph. It must be symmetric.
source - the source of the digraph. All incoming edges to the sink must have capacity 0.
sink - the sink of the digraph. All outgoing edges from the sink must have capacity 0.
capacities - an edge attribute array describing non negative edge capacities.
flip - a set of edge attributes describing for each edge its reverse.
Returns:
a list of Nodes S from the digraph which contains the source and defines a min cut of the graph in terms of minimizing the sum of the edges contained in S x complement(S).

maxFlow

public static IntEdgeMap maxFlow(Digraph digraph,
                                 Node source,
                                 Node sink,
                                 IntEdgeMap capacities,
                                 EdgeMap<Edge> flip)
Compute a maximal flow for a properly prepared st-digraph.

Parameters:
digraph - the input digraph. It must be symmetric.
source - the source of the digraph.
sink - the sink of the digraph.
capacities - an edge attribute array describing positive edge capacities.
Returns:
an edge attribute array defining a maximum flow through the graph.

flow

public IntEdgeMap flow()
Return the maximum flow for the given digraph.

statistics

public MaxFlow.Statistics statistics()
Return the statistics from the previous run.

globalFactor

public float globalFactor()
Returns the global relabelling factor, which controls how frequently global relabelling occurs.

If this method returns h, then global relabelling occurs every edgeSize()/h relabelling operations. Global relabelling is built on breadth first search and takes O(edgeSize()) time. The default value is 5.

Returns:
the global relabelling factor.

globalFactor

public float globalFactor(float h)
Set and returns the global relabelling factor, which controls how frequently global relabelling occurs.

If this method returns h, then global relabelling occurs every edgeSize()/h relabelling operations. Global relabelling is built on breadth first search and consequently takes O(edgeSize()) time.

Returns:
the global relabelling factor.

totalFlow

public int totalFlow()
Return the total amount of flow which can go from the source to the sink in the network.

minCut

public java.util.BitSet minCut()
For use after run()ning the algorithm, this method computes a mincut.

Returns:
a list of the nodes which comprise a cut of the graph and contains the source vertex. The list is in breadth first search order. The method may also return null if the computed flow is not optimal, but this should not happen.

reset

protected void reset()
Re-initialize the data structures in order to re-run the algorithm.

Compute the maximum flow.
